intro: Coccoloba klotzschiana, commonly known as the Trinidad morning glory, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a waxy surface and produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and purple. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various environmental conditions. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
